| the six lowest bits of the path&lowbar;op byte, an index or other data associated with the given branch type
| `sel&lowbar;mask` 
| mask for checking whether this path&lowbar;op is branching into a selection
| `leaf&lowbar;mask` 
| mask for checking whether this path&lowbar;op refers to the final leaf in a path
| `branch` 
| after ANDing with high bits, a path&lowbar;op with this value can be said to be a regular branch
| `sel&lowbar;branch` 
| after ANDing with high bits, a path&lowbar;op with this value can be said to be a selection branch
| `leaf&lowbar;branch` 
| after ANDing with high bits, a path&lowbar;op with this value can be said to be a leaf branch
| `leaf&lowbar;sel&lowbar;branch` 
| after ANDing with high bits, a path&lowbar;op with this value can be said to be a leaf selection branch
| `root&lowbar;path` 
| if this is the first path&lowbar;op in a path, it means the path refers to the root element
|===
